messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 268
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/9/02 10:22:43 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/9/02 10:22:43 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
How about a picnic at the zoo or the lake? I might be able to wrangle a boat
even. At the OTHER lake, my brother-in-law has a house and a boat---that's
sounding even better. (Now I'll have to suck-up!). Or we can just hang
here. >>


Yes, that kind of sightseeing is what I meant. I just thought it would be
cool to hang out away from the conference, with no agenda really. Beach,
park, pool, whatever.....

My Trevor is really into gaming...he would be so thrilled to hang out with
kids that are into gaming or comics. He's 12....at the time of the conference
he'll be only a couple months from turning 13. All of my wee ones are coming
with, possibly dh too, it depends.
I'll probably miss a lot of workshops if dh doesn't come, because babsy boy
will be too hard to keep with. Maybe some of the teens are into babysitting?
I guess Trevor could a little bit, but I really want him to have freedom to
wander and meet people.

Ren
